alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDuffie, south central Columbia, northwestern Burke and southwestern Richmond Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Hephzibah, or 10 miles southwest of Fort Gordon, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Hephzibah, McBean, Blythe, Keysville, Ellwood, Leitner Lake Conference Center, Diamond Lakes Regional Park, Bath-Edie and Pea Patch Aerodrome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
